reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 117/11: PROHIBITED DEVELOPMENTS: OPENING A MINE
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 117/11: PROHIBITED DEVELOPMENTS: OPENING A MINE

content.content: 1. (1) In this section, “mine production” means mining that is producing any mineral or mineral-bearing substance for immediate sale or stockpiling for future sale, and includes the development of a mine for such purposes.  O. Reg. 117/11, s. 1 (1). (2) Paragraph 1 of subsection 12 (1) and paragraph 2 of subsection 14 (2) of the Act prohibit the opening of a mine if, (a) a person is required to file a certified closure plan for the mine under section 141 of the Mining Act in order to commence or recommence mine production; and (b) before the day the Act comes into force, the Director has not acknowledged receipt of a certified closure plan for the mine under section 141 of the Mining Act.  O. Reg. 117/11, s. 1 (2).
content.raw_html:
1. (1) In this section,

“mine production” means mining that is producing any mineral or mineral-bearing substance for immediate sale or stockpiling for future sale, and includes the development of a mine for such purposes.  O. Reg. 117/11, s. 1 (1).

(2) Paragraph 1 of subsection 12 (1) and paragraph 2 of subsection 14 (2) of the Act prohibit the opening of a mine if,

(a) a person is required to file a certified closure plan for the mine under section 141 of the Mining Act in order to commence or recommence mine production; and

(b) before the day the Act comes into force, the Director has not acknowledged receipt of a certified closure plan for the mine under section 141 of the Mining Act.  O. Reg. 117/11, s. 1 (2).

content.content: 3. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).  O. Reg. 117/11, s. 3.
content.raw_html: 3. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).  O. Reg. 117/11, s. 3.
